title: Android Weekly Issue #631
description: Articles & Tutorials Sponsored The Fallacy of “Full-Stack” Observability Tools Discover why mobile teams cannot achieve full-stack observability with a single, all-in-one solution and what they actually need to achieve true observability over their mobile apps and reliably deliver optimal performance. Learn more in this blog post. Overscroll animations in Jetpack Compose sinasamaki shows how to add bouncy overscroll animations to all your scrolling elements. Koin Roadmap Update — From 3.6 to 4.0 Arnaud Giuliani shares some important updates about the future of Koin. Sponsored Embrace and Grafana Team Up Embrace and Grafana Labs have joined forces to bring advanced observability to mobile apps using OpenTelemetry. This collaboration enables engineers to integrate mobile telemetry from Embrace with backend performance data in Grafana, providing a comprehensive view of application health and user experiences. Mastering Date and Time Management with Kotlinx DateTime Tom Sabel explore how to manage date and time functionalities using Kotlinx DateTime in iOS, offering clear, step-by-step instructions to ensure a smooth transition. Type Safe Bottom Navigation in Jetpack Compose While many articles cover the basics of the new Compose Navigation, Konstantin Merenkov guides us deeper into the Type Safe BottomBar routes. Stack vs. Heap in Kotlin: Understanding Memory Sandeep Kella dives into the magical world of stack and heap memory using some fun, everyday analogies. New ways of optimizing stability in Jetpack Compose Tomáš Mlynarič covers what cases strong skipping mode solves for you and what needs to be manually controlled. Stacked Cards Layout With Compose - And Cats Eevis Panula builds a stacked card custom layout in Compose. Restartable functions from first principles Zach Klippenstein's deep dive on restartable functions, which are a core concept of Jetpack Compose. Shared Element Transitions in Jetpack Compose Victor Brandalise shows how to use shared element transitions in Jetpack Compose. remember vs rememberSaveable Amit Shekhar examines the difference between remember and rememberSaveable in Jetpack Compose. Place a sponsored post Advertise your Android dev course to over 80k readers We reach out to more than 80k Android developers around the world, every week, through our email newsletter and social media channels. Advertise your Android development course! Libraries & Code Film-Time A Movie and TV shows tracking app illustrating Android development best practices with Jetpack Compose News Enabling more private generative AI This post explains to use the recently released GenC open-source project to combine Confidential Computing, the Gemma open-source models, and mobile platforms together to begin experimenting with building your own gen AI-powered apps. What's new in Kotlin 2.0.20-Beta2 Here's what's new in Kotlin 2.0.20-Beta2﻿ Videos & Podcasts Kotlin Multiplatform at Google I/O with Marcello Galhardo Nicola Corti interviews Marcello Galhardo, Software Engineer at Google. Marcello is working in the AndroidX team responsible for adding Kotlin Multiplatform support for several popular AndroidX libraries. Implement Firebase Firestore in your app using Jetpack Compose Daniel Atitienei demonstrates how to read, write, and update documents using the Firestore database. HTTP Requests in Kotlin Multiplatform With Ktor - KMP for Beginners Philipp Lackner shows how to make HTTP requests with Ktor in Kotlin Multiplatform. Crashlytics for your Android apps Kevin Morales talking about Crashlytics (service by Firebase) and how to implement in your Android apps with Kotlin. Kotlin Code Reuse: Composing like you're Inheriting Dave Leeds explore what it means to favor composition over inheritance, considers the characteristics that are affected by it, and looks at an underrated Kotlin feature that can change our perspective on it! App Icon & Splash Screen for iOS and Android Stevdza-San shows how to set a common app icon and splash screen when using Compose Multiplatform. The only way to Secure API Keys in Android! Charfaoui Younes explores the challenges of securing API Keys in Android projects, showcasing the only way you can secure it from all types of attacks.
text: Discover why mobile teams cannot achieve full-stack observability with a single, all-in-one solution and what they actually need to achieve true observability over their mobile apps and reliably deliver optimal performance. Learn more in this blog post. Embrace and Grafana Labs have joined forces to bring advanced observability to mobile apps using OpenTelemetry. This collaboration enables engineers to integrate mobile telemetry from Embrace with backend performance data in Grafana, providing a comprehensive view of application health and user experiences. A Movie and TV shows tracking app illustrating Android development best practices with Jetpack Compose This post explains to use the recently released GenC open-source project to combine Confidential Computing, the Gemma open-source models, and mobile platforms together to begin experimenting with building your own gen AI-powered apps. Dave Leeds explore what it means to favor composition over inheritance, considers the characteristics that are affected by it, and looks at an underrated Kotlin feature that can change our perspective on it! ]]>
html:
Discover why mobile teams cannot achieve full-stack observability with a single, all-in-one solution and what they actually need to achieve true observability over their mobile apps and reliably deliver optimal performance. Learn more in this blog post.

Embrace and Grafana Labs have joined forces to bring advanced observability to mobile apps using OpenTelemetry. This collaboration enables engineers to integrate mobile telemetry from Embrace with backend performance data in Grafana, providing a comprehensive view of application health and user experiences.

A Movie and TV shows tracking app illustrating Android development best practices with Jetpack Compose

This post explains to use the recently released GenC open-source project to combine Confidential Computing, the Gemma open-source models, and mobile platforms together to begin experimenting with building your own gen AI-powered apps.

Dave Leeds explore what it means to favor composition over inheritance, considers the characteristics that are affected by it, and looks at an underrated Kotlin feature that can change our perspective on it!

]]>
